result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn William Peterson

records.addlTxt: 8/16/2022 at 1pm: Defendant Shawn William Peterson  appeared in court in Burnett County in front of Judge Mogen for PLEAS in 22TR124 & 22TR125.  Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson in court for Shawn William Peterson. Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  All appear in person.  In regards to Judge Tolan's Burnett County case 22CF50, def's phone accidently got set to do not disturb and he missed court last week, he contacted his Attny 20 mins late, once he realized.  Judge Tolan authorized warrant but stayed until this date and time for def to appear.  Judge Mogen notes def appeared here in person, and will let Judge Tolan's office know.
Defendant appeared in person for court on 8/16/2022 at 1pm in front of Judge Mogen on 22TR124 and 22TR125 as scheduled.
Stayed until 8/16/2022 at 1pm.

11:00 AM Called 22CF50 for STC.   Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson appeared by zoom phone for Shawn William Peterson. Defendant Shawn William Peterson not in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. State is in victim rights compliance.  State asks for WA for def's arrest for FTA.  Attny Anderson makes a statement, asks for WA to be stayed for a week and to give an update today. Attny has been in contact, def wishes to set this out for trial.  State notes Def is set for TR tickets with Judge Mogen on Tues, 8/16/22.  Court notes that Bond signed says def will appear at all court dates, NOH was sent May 2022 to St. Paul address.  In July address was updated.  Court will authorize warrant, but will hold until Tues, August 16, 2022 at 1pm. Forfeit cash bond, stayed until 8/16/22 at 1pm as well.  Adjourned 11:09am.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:08 PM Called 22CF50, 22TR124 and 22TR125.  Defendant, Shawn William Peterson, appeared with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State in person.  Shawn William Peterson appeared by video means together with Attorney from Attny's office. Here for a WOPH.  Court has received doc 19, preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver.   Case 22CF50 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information, which matches the complaint.  15 day reservation on all pre-arrangement rights granted to the defense.   Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. Bond continues.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
See mins in Adjourned Initial Appearance.
Preliminary hearing on April 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:03 PM Called 22CF50 for Adjourned INIT, 22TR124 and 22TR125 for In.  Defendant, Shawn William Peterson, appeared in person with Attorney Bruce Patrick Anderson by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State in person.    Case 22CF50 on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG entered on misdemeanor count. Def confirms contact info current.  Waive time limits for PH.  NG pleas entered on TR cases. Bond continues. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 004075,
Payable Number: 75701,
Amount: $20.00
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

02:45 PM Cases 22CF50, 22TR124, and 22TR125 called together.  Defendant Shawn William Peterson not in court.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court does not default TRs- due to intake date.  State requests warrant.  Court issues warrant, $500 cash, only judge may quash.  Court orders cash bond forfeited.
DIS - Certified Copies of Polk Bail Bonds
Letter from DA re: Copy of summons and complaint to defendant
No driving any vehicle that is not legally registered and insured.  No driving with any open intoxicants.
